item.title: Lydia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I'm just going to write because I cannot help it." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Lydia add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "When I was your age, television was called books." -- William Goldman

item.title: Lydia add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Life is pain, highness. Anyone who says differently is selling something." -- William Goldman

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "I want to do something splendid… Something heroic or wonderful that won’t be forgotten after I’m dead… I think I shall write books." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "I've got the key to my castle in the air, but whether I can unlock the door remains to be seen." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "There are many Beths in the world, shy and quiet, sitting in corners till needed, and living for others so cheerfully that no one sees the sacrifices till the little cricket on the hearth stops chirping, and the sweet, sunshiny presence vanishes, leaving silence and shadow behind." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Lydia add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Isn't it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Lydia add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "I am simply a 'book drunkard.' Books have the same irresistible temptation for me that liquor has for its devotee. I cannot withstand them." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Lydia add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "My life is a perfect graveyard of buried hopes." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "I can't help flying up on the wings of anticipation. It's as glorious as soaring through a sunset... almost pays for the thud." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "she was richer in those dreams than in realities; for things seen pass away, but the things that are unseen are eternal." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Lydia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Lydia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A children's story that can only be enjoyed by children is not a good children's story in the slightest." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Lydia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "It is a good rule after reading a new book, never to allow yourself another new one till you have read an old one in between." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Lydia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I can't imagine a man really enjoying a book and reading it only once." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Lydia add a quote by A.A. Milne
Lydia add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Did you ever stop to think, and forget to start again?" -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Lydia add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Sometimes,' said Pooh, 'the smallest things take up the most room in your heart." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Francisco X. Stork
item.description: "Be in the world but not of the world.' The words are from Jesus. But I have not the slightest idea how to accomplish that or even if it's possible. The world will always poke you in the chest with its index finger." -- Francisco X. Stork

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "The great thing about getting older is that you don't lose all the other ages you've been." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "When I have something to say that I think will be too difficult for adults, I write it in a book for children. Children are excited by new ideas; they have not yet closed the doors and windows of their imaginations. Provided the story is good... nothing is too difficult for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "Bea says that the art of reading is slowly dying, that it's an intimate ritual, that a book is a mirror that offers us only what we already carry inside us, that when we read, we do it with all our heart and mind, and great readers are becoming more scarce by the day." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafon
item.description: "Once, in my father's bookshop, I heard a regular customer say that few things leave a deeper mark on a reader than the first book that finds its way into his heart. Those first images, the echo of words we think we have left behind, accompany us throughout our lives and sculpt a palace in our memory to which, sooner or later—no matter how many books we read, how many worlds we discover, or how much we learn or forget—we will return." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafon

item.title: Lydia add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Little by little, one travels far" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "If all the world hated you and believed you wicked, while your own conscience approved of you and absolved you from guilt, you would not be without friends." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description: "I love books, by the way, way more than movies. Movies tell you what to think. A good book lets you choose a few thoughts for yourself. Movies show you the pink house. A good book tells you there's a pink house and lets you paint some of the finishing touches, maybe choose the roof style,park your own car out front. My imagination has always topped anything a movie could come up with. Case in point, those darned Harry Potter movies. That was so not what that part-Veela-chick, Fleur Delacour, looked like." -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: Lydia add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Lydia add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot
